alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 27 at 8:56AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, around Mendenhall Lake and river in Juneau. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 853 AM AKDT, River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in Areas around Skaters Cabin Road, the Mendenhall campground and the visitor center. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Mendenhall Lake area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 8:15am the stage was 8.26 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 9.65 feet is expected around 4:00pm Thursday.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
